thread.title: Dozens of Central Texas restaurants, bars and busi
thread.title_full: Dozens of Central Texas restaurants, bars and busi

author: Tara Brolley
title: Dozens of Central Texas restaurants, bars and busi
text:
Dozens of Central Texas restaurants, bars and businesses are donating profits to flood relief efforts following devastating floods that hit Kerr County and surrounding areas over the weekend. (Scroll down to see full list of participating businesses)
At least 10 businesses are participating in coordinated fundraising efforts Thursday, with many more extending donations through the weekend and beyond.
Kerbey Lane All Day Cafe announced it will donate 100% of profits from all 10 locations Thursday to the Kerr County Flood Relief Fund.
"As parents and lifelong members of the Central Texas community, our hearts go out to everyone impacted by the recent floods in Texas," said Christina and Mason Ayer, owners of Kerbey Lane All Day Cafe. "At Kerbey Lane, giving back is at the core of who we are, and donating 100% of profits from all 10 Kerbey Lane locations to the Kerr County Flood Relief Fund is one way we can swiftly act and stand with our neighbors during this devastating time."
P. Terry's Burger Stand is also donating 100% of profits from all 36 locations Thursday, with funds going to the Austin Disaster Relief Network's "Central Texas Flood" campaign.
Other businesses participating in Thursday's coordinated effort include Veracruz All Natural, which will donate 100% of profits from seven locations to the American Red Cross Hill Country Chapter; Kesos Tacos, donating profits to the Kerr County Flood Relief Fund; and Moonshine Patio Bar & Grill, also supporting the Kerr County fund.
Hattie B's Hot Chicken announced 100% of sales from Austin and Dallas stores Thursday will benefit the Central Texas Food Bank's flood victim assistance efforts.
Several businesses have extended their fundraising efforts beyond Thursday. Good Vibration Pizza began donating 100% of profits Wednesday and plans to continue the effort. Mernin' Coffee is donating all profits through July 14.
LiftATX fitness studio is donating a portion of day passes through Sunday to the Kerr County Relief Fund.
Weekend efforts include Tyler's Westlake location donating 100% of profits Friday, and Tumble 22 donating all profits from multiple locations Friday. Central Texas Machine Works will donate $1 from every pretzel, frozen cocktail and American Lager sold Saturday and Sunday.
Milam & Greene Whiskey announced it will donate 15% of all online and distillery sales through July 15 to the Community Foundation of Texas Hill Country, with additional donations from special releases.
